title: Climate Watch Historical GHG Emissions
technical_title: Climate Watch Historical Country Greenhouse Gas Emissions Data
summary: Historical country-level and sectoral GHG emissions data (1990-2020)
description:
Climate Watch Historical Emissions data contains sector-level greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions data for 194 countries and the European Union for the period 1990-2020, including emissions of the six major GHGs from most major sources and sinks. Non-CO2 emissions are expressed in CO2 equivalents using 100-year global warming potential values from the IPCC Fourth Assessment Report.
Population and GDP values are extracted from the World Bank Databank Development Indicators.
We are in the process of updating our old methodology, users can read our temporary methodology here.
cautions: Climate Watch Historical GHG Emissions data (previously published through CAIT Climate Data Explorer) are derived from several sources. Any use of the Land-Use Change and Forestry or Agriculture indicator should be cited as FAO 2022, FAOSTAT Emissions Database. Any use of CO2 emissions from fuel combustion data should be cited as CO2 Emissions from Fuel Combustion, OECD/IEA, 2022. As of March 2020, emissions from European Union (27) for all years no longer include emissions from United Kingdom on Climate Watch.
citation: Climate Watch Historical GHG Emissions. 2022. Washington, DC: World Resources Institute. Available online at: https://www.climatewatchdata.org/ghg-emissions

title: PIK-PRIMAP historical emissions
technical_title: The PRIMAP-hist national historical emissions time series
source_organization: Postdam Institute For Climate Impact Research
summary: The PRIMAP-hist national historical emissions time series (1750-2022) v2.5
description: The PRIMAP-hist dataset combines several published datasets to create a comprehensive set of greenhouse gas emission pathways for every country and Kyoto gas covering the years 1750 to 2022, and all UNFCCC (United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change) member states, as well as most non-UNFCCC territories. The scenario in which country-reported data (CRF, BUR, UNFCCC) is prioritized over third-party data (CDIAC, FAO, Andrew, EDGAR, BP) is used on Climate Watch. The data resolves the main IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change) 2006 categories. Subsector data for Energy, Industrial Processes, Agriculture and Waste is available for CO2, CH4, and N2O. Due to data availability and methodological issues, PRIMAP-hist dataset does not include emissions from land use, land use change, and forestry (LULUCF). Non-CO2 emissions are expressed in CO2 equivalents using 100-year global warming potential values from IPCC Fourth Assessment Report.
cautions:
Multiple scenarios are published by PIK. Climate Watch presents HISTCR where country-reported data are prioritized over third-party data, extrapolated data using AR4 GWP values.

When using this dataset or one of its updates, please also cite the data description article (Gutschow et al., 2016, http://doi.org/10.5194/essd-8-571-2016).

"The v2.4 release of PRIMAP-hist reduced the time-lag from 2 to 1 years. Thus the present version 2.5 includes data for 2022. For energy CO2 growth rates from the BP statistical review of world energy are used to extend the country reported (CR) or CDIAC (TP) data to 2022. For CO2 from cement production Andrew cement data are used. For other gases and sectors we have to rely on numerical methods until data becomes available."
citation:
Gütschow, J.; Pflüger, M. (2023): The PRIMAP-hist national historical emissions time series v2.5 (1750-2022). zenodo. doi:10.5281/zenodo.10006301.
Gütschow, J.; Jeffery, L.; Gieseke, R.; Gebel, R.; Stevens, D.; Krapp, M.; Rocha, M. (2016): The PRIMAP-hist national historical emissions time series, Earth Syst. Sci. Data, 8, 571-603, doi:10.5194/essd-8-571-2016

title: UNFCCC historical emissions
source_organization: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
summary: Greenhous gas inventory data reported by parties to the UNFCCC, and published through UNFCCC's GHG data interface
description: The GHG data interface includes GHG data received by the UNFCCC secretariat as of 24 October 2023. The GHG inventory data from UNFCCC are provided in the annual GHG inventory submissions by Annex I Parties and in the national communications and biennial update reports by non-Annex I Parties.
cautions:
For the purpose of Climate Watch, emissions estimates for EU(27) are calculated by adding up emissions inventories of 27 member countries of EU from UNFCCC Data Interface.

The reporting and review requirements for GHG inventories are different for Annex I and non-Annex I Parties. The definition format of data for emissions/removals from the forestry sector is different for Annex I and non-Annex I Parties.
Some non-Annex I Parties submitted their GHG inventory data using the format of the 2006 IPCC Guidelines in reporting GHG emissions/removals. For this reason, these data could not be included in the data interface. However, the data are available in the national communications (Albania, Andorra, Angola, Antigua and Barbuda, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Belize, Bhutan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Brunei Darussalam, Burkina Faso, Cabo Verde, Cambodia, Cook Islands, Costa Rica, Côte d'Ivoire, Colombia, Cuba, Equatorial Guinea, Eswatini, Ethiopia, Fiji, Gabon, Gambia, Georgia, Ghana, Grenada, Guatemala, Honduras, Indonesia, Iran, Jamaica, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Lesotho, Malaysia, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, Montenegro, Morocco, Namibia, Nepal, Nicaragua, Nigeria, North Macedonia, Panama, Paraguay, Oman, Republic of Moldova, Rwanda, Samoa, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Sierra Leone, Singapore, Somalia, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Suriname, Tajikistan, Timor-Leste, Trinidad and Tobago, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, Vanuatu, Venezuela, Viet Nam, Zambia and Zimbabwe) and biennial update reports (Afghanistan, Albania, Andorra, Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Belize, Benin, Bhutan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Burundi, Cambodia, Central African Republic, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Côte d'Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Dominican Republic, Egypt, El Salvador, Gabon, Georgia, Ghana, Guatemala, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Honduras, India, Indonesia, Jordan, Kyrgyzstan, Laos Peoples Republic, Lesotho, Liberia, Malawi, Malaysia, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Micronesia, Mongolia, Montenegro, Morocco, Namibia, Niger, Nigeria, North Macedonia, Oman, Pakistan, Panama, Paraguay, Papua New Guinea, Peru, Republic of Korea, Republic of Moldova, Rwanda, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Sao Tome and Principe, Serbia, Singapore, Somalia, South Africa, Suriname, Tajikistan, Thailand, Togo, Trinidad and Tobago, Tunisia, Uruguay, Uganda, Uzbekistan, Viet Nam, and Zambia).
Data displayed on the data interface are "as received" from Parties. The publication of Party submissions on this website does not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of the UNFCCC or the Secretariat of the United Nations concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries as may be referred to in any of the submissions.
See the complete list of notes on GHG data by UNFCCC here: https://unfccc.int/process-and-meetings/transparency-and-reporting/greenhouse-gas-data/notes-on-ghg-data.
summary_of_licenses: Public domain, may be freely downloaded, copied and printed provided no change to the content is introduced, and the source is acknowledged.
citation: UNFCCC. 2023. Greenhouse Gas Inventory Data. Accessed December 2023. https://di.unfccc.int.

title: Global Carbon Budget historical emissions
summary: Carbon dioxide emissions from fossil fuel
description: Carbon dioxide emissions from the use of coal, oil and gas (combustion and industrial processes), the process of gas flaring and the manufacture of cement
cautions: Climate Watch displays only territorial CO2 emissions. Global Carbon Project publishes additional data with regards to global carbon budget. Those data are not included on Climate Watch and can be found on: https://globalcarbonbudget.org. Data reported in million tonnes of carbon per year (MtC/yr) are converted to million tonnes of CO2 per year for purpose of Climate Watch by multiplying the values by 3.664.
summary_of_licenses: The use of data is conditional on citing the original data sources.
citation: Global Carbon Project. (2023). Supplemental data of Global Carbon Budget 2023 (Version 1.1) [Data set]. Global Carbon Project. https://doi.org/10.18160/gcp-2023

title: Climate Watch US State Historical GHG Emissions
technical_title: Climate Watch US State Historical Country Greenhouse Gas Emissions Data (1990-2020)
summary: Historical US State-level GHG emission data (1990-2020)
description: Climate Watch US State Historical Emission data contains sector-level greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions data for US States for the period 1990-2020, including emissions of the six major GHGs from most major sources and sinks.  Non-CO2 emissions are expressed in CO2 equivalents using 100-year global warming potential values from IPCC Fourth Assessment Report.
cautions: Climate Watch US State Historical GHG Emissions data are sourced from State GHG Emissions and Removals published by the US EPA. Avaialble at: https://www.epa.gov/ghgemissions/state-ghg-emissions-and-removals
citation: Climate Watch US State Historical GHG Emissions. 2023. Washington, DC: World Resources Institute. Available online at: https://www.climatewatchdata.org/ghg-emissions
